citeinfo.origin: Jill Andrew, The Nature Conservancy , GIS Technician
citeinfo.title: LA_Preserves

descript.abstract: This dataset consists of manually drawn polygons representing each preserve. They were digitized upon a case-by-case basis using the most accurate information available. Sources for mapping the preserves include: survey plats, legal descriptions, parish assessor’s geoportal websites and TNC maps. Below are the processes of how each source was utilized in digitization:Survey Plats – Survey plats are the most accurate source available. It is a map showing what is perceived to be the legal boundary based on collected information (e.g. bearings and distance) from a certified land surveyor. Property boundaries were drawn in ArcGIS using the bearing, or azimuth, and distance of each line shown on the plat. The angular units were set to Quadrant Bearing and Degrees Minutes Seconds in the Editing Options menu to ensure the accuracy of each line’s placement on the map.Legal Description – Legal Descriptions are also accurate sources of information as they are, in most instances, the text version of a survey plat. The methods used for mapping survey plats were also applied to legal descriptions.Parish Assessors’ Geoportal Websites – Some parishes in the state have made land boundaries available via an interactive web map. Property boundaries can be exported as pdf maps. Those maps were converted to jpeg format and georeferenced. The boundaries were traced from the georeferenced image. TNC Maps- Some preserves were digitized based on older maps from TNC files. These were either manually drawn or georeferenced and traced.
descript.purpose: The LA Preserves Points dataset was created by the Louisiana Nature Conservancy (TNC) to digitally track ownership properties within the state. The dataset is designed to store, maintain and update property information that is used by TNC staff and external partners.

idinfo.useconst: The Nature Conservancy provides the property information contained herein and makes no warranty as to the accuracy or suitability of the data. Users assume all risk and responsibility for any and all damages, including consequential damages, which may flow from the users use of this information. GIS is not intended to replace legal descriptions from government official documents such as those found in County Clerk records or the courts nor does it substitute for actual legal surveys. The information contained herein is believed accurate and suitable to limited uses and subject to the limited uses stated above.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.2.3552

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Name of feature according to TNC preserve files

attr.attrdef: GIS calculated area in square feet using NAD_1983_StatePlane_Louisiana_North_FIPS_1701_Feet and NAD_1983_StatePlane_Louisiana_South_FIPS_1702_Feet.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are generated.

attr.attrdef: GIS calculated perimeter in feet using NAD_1983_StatePlane_Louisiana_North_FIPS_1701_Feet and NAD_1983_StatePlane_Louisiana_South_FIPS_1702_Feet.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are generated.

attr.attrdef: GIS calculated acres in feet using NAD_1983_StatePlane_Louisiana_North_FIPS_1701_Feet and NAD_1983_StatePlane_Louisiana_South_FIPS_1702_Feet.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are generated.

attr.attrdef: Type describes a property's classification. The dataset includes Preserves (Fee title ownership), Legacy Preserves (Gifted) and Conservation Buyer Preserves (Sale) properties.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are generated.
